qas.question: When was the last major attack London saw?
How many tonnes of bombs did the Luftwaffe use on London?

answers.text: 1,436 people were killed and 1,792 seriously injured

qas.question: What was the damage done to London's streets?

answers.text: One-third of London's streets were impassable

qas.question: What showed RAF night fighter effectiveness was increasing?

answers.text: 63 German fighters were sent with the bombers

context: The last major attack on London was on <a0_0>10/11 May 1941<a0_0/>, on which the Luftwaffe flew 571 sorties and dropped <a1_0>800 tonnes<a1_0/> of bombs. This caused more than 2,000 fires. <a2_0>1,436 people were killed and 1,792 seriously injured<a2_0/>, which affected morale badly. Another raid was carried out on 11/12 May 1941. Westminster Abbey and the Law Courts were damaged, while the Chamber of the House of Commons was destroyed. <a3_0>One-third of London's streets were impassable<a3_0/>. All but one railway station line was blocked for several weeks. This raid was significant, as <a4_0>63 German fighters were sent with the bombers<a4_0/>, indicating the growing effectiveness of RAF night fighter defences.
